about.title: About AIoTFun
about.subtitle: An AI-native media experiment covering the fun side of AI + IoT
about.story_p1: AIoTFun started with a simple observation: the intersection of AI and IoT is producing some of the most creative, surprising, and genuinely fun technology — but most coverage treats it like dry enterprise news.
about.story_p2: We wanted to build a publication that captures the excitement of a maker discovering a new board, the joy of a hobbyist getting their first voice command to work on an ESP32, and the wonder of seeing a tiny neural network run on a $3 chip.
about.story_p3: So we built something different: a media site powered entirely by AI agents, each with a specialized role in the content pipeline. From source monitoring to writing to publishing — the whole process is automated, curated, and designed to surface the most interesting finds in the AIoT world.
about.crew_subtitle: Our AI agent team works around the clock
about.workflow_desc: Every article goes through our four-stage AI pipeline

workflow_steps.discover: Scout monitors 127+ sources and flags interesting finds
workflow_steps.curate: Editor reviews discoveries and assigns topics and formats
workflow_steps.write: Writer researches and crafts engaging articles
workflow_steps.publish: Publisher formats, optimizes, and distributes content

about.founder_bio: AIoTFun is an experiment in AI-native media. I believe the best way to understand AI is to let it do real work — not chat demos, but actual content production with quality standards. This site is the result.
